content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function called `wrap_string` that iterates over words and adds a new line each time the maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    current_line = ""
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n$current_line"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    if length(current_line) > 0
        result *= "\n$current_line"
    end
    
    return result
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec id justo eu tellus volutpat congue. Sed malesuada, massa at aliquam bibendum, sapien enim sagittis eros, quis varius velit nisl ut orci."
wrap_result = wrap_string(text)
println(wrap_result)
```
Output:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec id justu
e tellus volutpat congue. Sed malesuada, massa at aliquam bibendum, sapien enim sagittis eros, quis varius velit nisl ut orci.
```
